classitems.author: peshkov@UD

classitems.description:
Determine if any requested template exists and return path to it.

== Usage ==
The function will search through: STYLESHEETPATH, TEMPLATEPATH, and any custom paths you pass as second argument.

$best_template = UD\Utility::get_template_part( array(
  'template-ideal-match',
  'template-default',
), array( PATH_TO_MY_TEMPLATES );

Note: load_template() extracts $wp_query->query_vars into the loaded template, so to add any global variables to the template, add them to
$wp_query->query_vars prior to calling this function.
classitems.name: array $name List of requested templates. Will be return the first found
classitems.path: array $path [optional]. Method tries to find template in theme, but also it can be found in given list of pathes.
classitems.load: boolean [optional]. If true and a template is found, the template will be loaded via load_template() and returned as a string
classitems.author: peshkov@UD

classitems.description:
Determine if any requested template exists and return path to it.

classitems.name: array $name List of requested templates. Will be return the first found
classitems.path: array $path [optional]. Method tries to find template in theme, but also it can be found in given list of pathes.
classitems.author: peshkov@UD

classitems.description:
Set default instance.
Template can depend on instance. For example: facebook, PDF, etc.

The goal of function is going through specific filters and return (or print) classes. This function should not be called directly. Every ud plugin/theme should have own short function ( wrapper ) for calling it. E.g., see: wpp_css(). So, use it in template as:
">
Arguments: - instance [string] - UD plugin|theme's slug. E.g.: wpp, denali, wpi, etc - element [string] - specific element in template which will use the current classes. Element should be called as {template}::{specific_name_of_element}. Where {template} is name of template, where current classes will be used. This standart is optional. You can set any element's name if you want. - classes [array] - set of classes which will be used for element. - return [boolean] - If false, the function prints all classes like 'class1 class2 class3'
classitems.author: peshkov@UD

classitems.description: Return simple array of column tables in a table
Port of jQuery.extend() function.

Returns a URL to a post object based on passed variable.

If its a number, then assumes its the id, If it resembles a slug, then get the first slug match.

params.name: string
params.description: $title A page title, although ID integer can be passed as well

return.description: string The page's URL if found, otherwise the general blog URL

classitems.description: Used to get the current plugin's log created via UD class If no log exists, it creates one, and then returns it in chronological order. Example to view log: print_r( self::get_log() ); $param string Event description

return.description: array Using the get_option function returns the contents of the log.

classitems.description: Delete UD log for this plugin.
Creates Admin Menu page for UD Log

uses: add_action() Calls 'admin_menu' hook with an anonymous ( lambda-style ) function which uses add_menu_page to create a UI Log page

classitems.description:
Turns a passed string into a URL slug

Argument 'check_existance' will make the function check if the slug is used by a WordPress post

params.name: string
params.description: $args Optional list of arguments to overwrite the defaults.

uses: add_action() Calls 'admin_menu' hook with an anonymous (lambda-style) function which uses add_menu_page to create a UI Log page

classitems.description: Convert a slug to a more readable string

Returns location information from Google Maps API call.

From version 1.2.0, the geohash is generated automatically.
Returns avaliability of Google's Geocoding Service based on time of last returned status OVER_QUERY_LIMIT

params.name: type
params.description: $update used to set option value in time()

classitems.description: Returns date and/or time using the WordPress date or time format, as configured.

params.name: string
params.description: $time Date or time to use for calculation.

params.description: $args List of arguments to overwrite the defaults.

Missing item type
Prepares data for SQL query.

i.e. It should be used when $pwdb->prepare cannot be used.
For example:
we have situation when SQL query could not be prepared by default $wpdb->prepare:
$titles = array( "John's appartment", " '; DELETE FROM $wpdb->posts;# " );
$wpdb->query( "SELECT ID FROM $wpdb->posts WHERE post_title IN ( '" . implode ("','", UD_Utility::prepare_to_sql( $titles ) ) . "' ) " );
